meanings.definition: Remove the contents of (a body cavity)
meanings.sent1: The surgeon had to exenterate the tumor from the patient's abdomen.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist carefully exenterated the ancient burial site to uncover any artifacts.
meanings.sent3: After the food fight, the cafeteria staff had to exenterate the mashed potatoes from the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to exenterate the truth from the suspect's conflicting statements.
meanings.sent5: The gardener exenterated the weeds from the flower bed, leaving it clean and tidy.

meanings.sent1: The hunter needed to exenterate the deer after the successful hunt.
meanings.sent2: The butcher skillfully exenterated the fish for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician accidentally exenterated the rabbit during the magic show.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to exenterate the landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The zombie movie showed a gruesome scene where the undead creatures exenterated their victims.

meanings.definition: To remove the internal organs of (a body)
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians exenterated bodies before mummification.
meanings.sent2: The medical examiner had to exenterate the cadaver to determine the cause of death.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to exenterate the fish before preparing it for the dinner service.
meanings.sent4: The predator skillfully exenterated its prey before consuming it.
meanings.sent5: The ritual required the shaman to exenterate the sacrificial animal as an offering to the gods.
